intro: Apodanthera crispa, commonly known as the crinkled apodanthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a crinkled or wavy texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in umbels, and are usually yellow or greenish in color. Apodanthera crispa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
